newsitem.title: UK: Med oil products end mixed as holidays dampen trade.
newsitem.headline: Med oil products end mixed as holidays dampen trade.

text.p: Mediterranean oil products ended mixed on Friday, with trade limited by public holidays in a number of countries including Italy and Portugal.

In the gas oil market attention was riveted on the ever-narrowing arbitrage to Asia, with some wary traders taking a safe view of sitting on the sidelines. The arb appears open by $2 or so, but difficulty in finding tankers could pressure prices lower, traders said.
So far Russian and Italian 0.2 pct cargoes have held onto levels between high fob quotes +$3.50-4.00. Diesel retained strength on tight supplies around fob high EN590 quotes +$2-3.
Med fuel oil prices were steady, although discussion was limited by the regional holidays.
Recent activity has limited the high sulphur cargoes showing available but dealers appeared relaxed, anticipating fresh supplies over the horizon.
Dealers reported demand for bunker spec material in Gibraltar, Spain and the Canary Islands.
Traders were watching for one large cargo to head towards Asia, with some worrying that dramatic product demand in Singapore might collapse, with unpleasant consequences in their home region.
Gasoline was steady as the absence of a number of players dampened trade.
The market was assessed as fairly balanced due to the fact that many players had sought to cover their requirements ahead of the holiday period.

Naphtha was slightly stronger, but the market continued to monitor the double stem loading issue out of Skikda in case the suspension on larger cargoes led to a rise in cargoes being offered into the Mediterranean.
"We won't know until Monday what their decision is," one trader said. -- London Newsroom, +44 171 542 7714.
